thread.title: NBA All-Star Game 2017: LeBron James sinks 40-foot jumper with ease
thread.title_full: NBA All-Star Game 2017: LeBron James sinks 40-foot jumper with ease

author: Nick Birdsong (nbirdsong@sportingnews.com)
title: NBA All-Star Game 2017: LeBron James sinks 40-foot jumper with ease
text:
February 19, 2017 9:59pm   9:48pm EST The King must think he's Chef Curry with the shot. LeBron James (Getty Images) 
Updated at 9:59 p.m. ET 
Updated at 9:59 p.m. ET 
The East and West combined for 189 points in the first half of the NBA All-Star Game at Smoothie King Center in New Orleans Sunday night.Â 
With rosters that included high-risers such as Russell Westbrook, DeMar DeRozan, John Wall and DeAndre Jordan, the most impressive play of the first 24 minutes of action wasn't even a dunk. It was a jumper.Â 
LeBron James, shooting his best percentage from behind the 3-point line since the 2012-13 season at 38.9 percent, got his Steph Curry on,Â calmly pullingÂ up and sinking aÂ 40-foot jumper.Â 
Release. Rotation. Splash (No Brothers).Â
